intro: Hesperidopsis, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. These plants are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, often yellow or orange, flowers that bloom in the spring. Hesperidopsis species are typically low-growing, forming dense mats that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. They have adapted to survive in extreme conditions through specialized root systems and water-storing tissues. The genus is part of the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species.
